docs.text: Glossary APL is rife with jargon. Since it is older than many of the more popular languages of today, some of the terms are quite different to those used for similar constructs in modern programming and computer science literature. Alpha ⍺ APL Functional Symbol Alpha Left argument in dfns Argument An array value which is passed to a function . Array APL Wiki Catenate APL Wiki Join two arrays along their first axis ⍪ or last axis , . Join two arrays along specified axes ⍪[a] ,[a] . Join two arrays by pairing cells of rank j and k : ⍪⍤j k (first axis), ,⍤j k (last axis) Dfn A style of function definition which encourages a functional programming style. Its left argument is referred to using ⍺ and its Synonyms lambda, curly brace function Dop First axis The first number in the shape ⍴⍵ of an array ⍵ . First-axis functions and operators operate on or between major cells of an array. First axis functions reverse -first catenate -first First axis operators reduce -first Fold Monadic operator [reduce] Function Synonyms operator (unary, binary, tertiary), procedure, subroutine Monadic An entity which accepts one. A monadic function takes one argument to its right which is an array . A monadic operator takes one operand to its left which is a function . Example: reduce / . Synonyms unary Omega Dyadic An entity which accepts two. A dyadic function takes two arguments, one to its left and one to its right . Synonyms: binary Niladic Operator Reduce APL Wiki Monadic operator f/ (or reduice- first f⌿ ) Tradfn Valence Variable
docs.title: Glossary
